author: Sam Schechner
title: Alcatel-Lucent Slashes Bonuses for Former CEO Michel Combes
text:
PARIS—Alcatel-Lucent SA has bowed to weeks of political pressure and agreed to slash in the half the bonuses to be paid to former Chief Executive Michel Combes, underscoring the pressure on French companies to rein in executive pay.
Alcatel-Lucent said on Friday that its board has decided to grant Mr. Combes a maximum of €7.9 million in total cash bonuses—including a long-term compensation bonus and payment for a noncompete clause—following the sale of the company to Nokia Corp which he oversaw.
